meanings.definition: Fail to reach the required standard in (an examination, test, or course).
meanings.sent1: She kept flunking her math tests.
meanings.sent2: He is worried about flunking the final exam.
meanings.sent3: The student joked that flunking math was his superpower.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence flunked when she couldn't solve the problem.
meanings.sent5: The idea of flunking haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: A failure to reach the required standard in (an examination, test, or course).
meanings.sent1: His flunking in chemistry surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher discussed the consequences of flunking.
meanings.sent3: The flunking on his report card made him strive harder.
meanings.sent4: The flunking in the competition left him disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The news of his flunking spread quickly through the school.
